repositories.name: cf-stats
repositories.readme:
# Codeforces Stat Visualization
# Installation ### For step-by-step screenshots go [here](docs/INSTALLATIONSTEPS.md) ### Video Demonstration - [Hindi](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lPASqH0ZoIc) 1. Star this repository :pray: 2. Create a copy of this repository by clicking [here](https://github.com/sudiptob2/cf-stats/generate). Note: this is **not** the same as forking a copy because it copies everything fresh, without the huge commit history. 3. Goto [config/.env.template](config/.env.template) and put your codeforces handle in the `CF_HANDLE` key. 4. Go to the [Actions Page](../../actions?query=workflow%3A"Generate+Stats+Images") and press "Run Workflow" on the right side of the screen to generate images for the first time. - The images will be automatically regenerated every 24 hours, but they can be regenerated manually by running the workflow this way. 5. Take a look at the images that have been created in the [`output`](output) folder. 6. To add your statistics to your GitHub Profile README, copy and paste the following lines of code into your markdown content. Change the `your-github-username` value to your GitHub username. ```md ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/your-github-username/cf-stats/main/output/light_card.svg#gh-dark-mode-only) ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/your-github-username/cf-stats/main/output/light_card.svg) ``` ```md ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sudiptob2/cf-stats/main/output/max_rating.svg) ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/sudiptob2/cf-stats/main/output/rating.svg) ``` # Contribution guideline If you like this project and want to improve by adding features, fixing bugs or anything, please follow the [contributing guidelines](docs/CONTRIBUTING.md). # Acknowledgments ### Contributors List - [Sudipto](https://github.com/sudiptob2) - [Nazmul](https://github.com/nazmulweb) - [Manish](https://github.com/csemanish12) ### Inspiration This project is heavily inspired by [github-stats](https://github.com/jstrieb/github-stats) project

repositories.name: Jamazon
repositories.readme:
# Jamazon - Event Manager ğŸ“…ğŸš€

**Jamazon** (also known as *Dinamic Events*) is a desktop application developed in Python for the efficient management of events and resources. It uses a modern graphical interface and advanced data structures to handle scheduling and avoid resource conflicts.

## ğŸŒŸ Key Features

* **Task Management:** Easily create and delete tasks.
* **Event Definition:** Schedule events with specific date and time ranges.
* **Resource Management:** Add resources and handle dependencies between them.
* **Conflict Detection:** Intelligent system that checks if necessary resources are available and do not conflict with other rules.
* **Modern Interface:** Dark and friendly GUI based on `customtkinter`.

## ğŸ› ï¸ Installation and Execution

Follow these steps to run the application in your local environment:

1. **Clone the repository:**

   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/Jamazon.git
   cd Jamazon
   ```

2. **Install dependencies:**
   Make sure you have Python installed. Then, install the necessary libraries:

   ```bash
   pip install -r requirements.txt
   ```

3. **Run the application:**

   ```bash
   python main.py
   ```

## ğŸ“– Usage Guide

Upon starting the application, you will see a control panel with the following options:

* **Create new task:** Opens a form to register a new task in the system.
* **Remove existing task:** Allows deleting tasks that are no longer needed.
* **Add Resource:** Adds new resources (e.g., rooms, equipment) that can be assigned to events.
* **Define new event:** Creates complex events that require resources and have a specific duration. The system will automatically validate if resources are available and if there are dependency conflicts.

## ğŸ§  Technical Details and Modules

The project is built with a modular approach. The main components are detailed below:

### 1. Core (`modules/`)

* **`app` (in `main.py`)**:
  * It is the main window of the application.
  * Configures the interface, loads images, and manages navigation to other tools.

* **`Calendar` (in `modules/calendar.py`)**:
  * Manages the list of active events and used resources.
  * Handles saving and loading the application state.
  * Coordinates task availability.

* **`event` (in `modules/events.py`)**:
  * Represents an individual event with date, time, and necessary resources.
  * **Validation:** Checks dependencies and resource collisions upon initialization. If there is a conflict, it prevents the event creation.

* **`SegTree` (in `modules/SegTree.py`)**:
  * Implements a **Segment Tree** with *Lazy Propagation*.
  * Used to perform efficient queries on time ranges, allowing quick verification of resource availability or usage in specific intervals.

### 2. Graphical Interface (`modules/gui_core/`)

* **`EventCreator` (in `EventDeffiner.py`)**: Window to enter details for new events.
* **`TaskCreator`**: Interface to register new tasks in the system.
* **`TaskRemover`**: Interface to delete existing tasks.
* **`ResAdder`**: Allows adding new resources to the database (`resources.json`).

## ğŸ“‚ Project Structure

```text
Jamazon/
â”œâ”€â”€ changelog           # Project change log
â”œâ”€â”€ clean.py            # Script to clean temporary files
â”œâ”€â”€ logs.txt            # Error and event log file
â”œâ”€â”€ main.py             # ğŸ Main entry point of the application
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md           # Project documentation
â”œâ”€â”€ requirements.txt    # List of Python dependencies
â”œâ”€â”€ test.py             # Script for quick tests
â”œâ”€â”€ modules/            # ğŸ§  Logical core of the system
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ calendar.py     # Calendar logic and availability
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ events.py       # Event class definition and validations
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ gvar.py         # Global variables
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ handlers.py     # Base handlers and utilities
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ SegTree.py      # Segment Tree implementation
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ utils.py        # General utility functions
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ gui_core/       # ğŸ¨ Graphical Interface Components
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ EventDeffiner.py  # Window to define new events
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ EventShower.py    # Event viewer
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ ResAdder.py       # Window to add resources
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ TaskCreator.py    # Window to create tasks
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ TaskRemover.py    # Window to delete tasks
â”œâ”€â”€ saved/              # Folder for saved data
â”œâ”€â”€ templates/          # ğŸ“„ Templates and static data
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ resources.json  # Database of available resources
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ tasks.json      # Database of saved tasks
â””â”€â”€ tests/              # ğŸ§ª Unit tests
```

## ğŸ¤ Contribution

Contributions are welcome! If you want to improve Jamazon:

1. Fork the project.
2. Create a branch for your new feature (`git checkout -b feature/new-feature`).
3. Make your changes and commit (`git commit -m "Add new feature"`).
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin feature/new-feature`).
5. Open a Pull Request.

---
Developed by [VIRUSGAMING64](https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64)

repositories.name: MPTB_vshell
repositories.description: Is an new modular python-telegram-bot version of vshell
repositories.readme:
# ğŸ¤– MPTB_vshell

**MPTB_vshell** es un framework de bot de Telegram modular y robusto, diseÃ±ado para integrar la potencia de **OpenAI (ChatGPT)** con capacidades avanzadas de gestiÃ³n de medios. Su arquitectura flexible permite una fÃ¡cil extensiÃ³n y personalizaciÃ³n.

## ğŸš€ CaracterÃ­sticas Principales

- **ğŸ¤– IntegraciÃ³n Profunda con Telegram**: Construido sobre `python-telegram-bot` para una interacciÃ³n fluida y reactiva.
- **ğŸ§  Inteligencia Artificial**: Soporte nativo para **OpenAI (ChatGPT)**, permitiendo conversaciones naturales y procesamiento de lenguaje.
- **ğŸ“‚ GestiÃ³n de Medios Avanzada**: Descarga y subida de archivos grandes y gestiÃ³n de medios utilizando la eficiencia de `Pyrogram`.
- **ğŸ‘¤ Sistema de Usuarios y Roles**: GestiÃ³n completa de usuarios, estados y permisos (Admin, Usuario, Banned, etc.).
- **ğŸ§© Arquitectura Modular**: CÃ³digo organizado en mÃ³dulos independientes (`brain`, `core`, `downup`, etc.) para facilitar el mantenimiento y la escalabilidad.
- **ğŸ’¾ Persistencia de Datos**: Sistema de base de datos simple pero efectivo para mantener el estado.

## ğŸ“‹ Requisitos

- ğŸ **Python 3.8** o superior.
- ğŸ“± Una cuenta de **Telegram** y un **Bot Token** (obtenido de @BotFather).
- ğŸ”‘ **API ID** y **API Hash** de Telegram (para Pyrogram, obtenible en my.telegram.org).
- ğŸ¤– **OpenAI API Key** (opcional, para funcionalidades de IA).

## ğŸ› ï¸ InstalaciÃ³n

1. **Clona el repositorio:**
   ```bash
   git clone <url-del-repositorio>
   cd MPTB_vshell
   ```

2. **Crea un entorno virtual (recomendado):**
   ```bash
   python -m venv .venv
   source .venv/bin/activate  # En Linux/Mac
   # .venv\Scripts\activate  # En Windows
   ```

3. **Instala las dependencias:**
   ```bash
   pip install -r requirements.txt
   ```

## âš™ï¸ ConfiguraciÃ³n

El bot utiliza variables de entorno para su configuraciÃ³n. Puedes establecerlas en tu sistema o crear un archivo `.env` (si usas una librerÃ­a para cargarlo) o exportarlas antes de ejecutar.

Las variables requeridas son:

| Variable | DescripciÃ³n |
|----------|-------------|
| `TOKEN` | Token del bot de Telegram. |
| `API_ID` | ID de aplicaciÃ³n de Telegram. |
| `API_HASH` | Hash de la API de Telegram. |
| `OPEN_AI` | Clave de API de OpenAI. |
| `ADMIN` | ID numÃ©rico del administrador principal. |
| `HTTP_PROXY` | (Opcional) Proxy HTTP. |
| `HTTPS_PROXY` | (Opcional) Proxy HTTPS. |

## â–¶ï¸ Uso

Una vez configurado, inicia el bot con el siguiente comando:

```bash
python bot.py
```

## ğŸ“‚ Estructura del Proyecto

```text
MPTB_vshell/
â”œâ”€â”€ bot.py                  # ğŸš€ Punto de entrada principal del bot
â”œâ”€â”€ clean.sh                # ğŸ§¹ Script de limpieza de archivos temporales
â”œâ”€â”€ database.csv            # ğŸ’¾ Base de datos simple (CSV)
â”œâ”€â”€ requirements.txt        # ğŸ“¦ Lista de dependencias
â”œâ”€â”€ runtests.py             # ğŸ§ª Script para ejecutar pruebas
â”œâ”€â”€ modules/                # ğŸ§© LÃ³gica modular del bot
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ brain.py            # ğŸ§  Cerebro: Procesamiento de mensajes
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ chatgpt.py          # ğŸ¤– IA: IntegraciÃ³n con OpenAI
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ database.py         # ğŸ—„ï¸ DB: Manejo de base de datos
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ gvar.py             # âš™ï¸ Config: Variables globales y entorno
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ utils.py            # ğŸ› ï¸ Utils: Herramientas varias
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ core/               # âš¡ Core: Comandos, colas y workers
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ downup/             # ğŸ“¥ğŸ“¤ DownUp: Descarga y subida de medios
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ entity/             # ğŸ‘¤ Entity: DefiniciÃ³n de objetos (User, etc.)
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ fuse/               # ğŸ”Œ Fuse: MÃ³dulos adicionales/experimentales
â”œâ”€â”€ web/                    # ğŸŒ Web: Interfaz web de administraciÃ³n
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ web.py
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ src/
â””â”€â”€ tests/                  # ğŸ§ª Tests: Pruebas unitarias
```

repositories.name: virusgaming64.github.io
repositories.readme:
# ğŸ® VIRUSGAMING64 Portfolio [![GitHub Pages](https://img.shields.io/badge/GitHub%20Pages-Live-success?style=for-the-badge&logo=github)](https://virusgaming64.github.io) [![Auto Update](https://img.shields.io/badge/Auto%20Update-Daily-blue?style=for-the-badge&logo=github-actions)](https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/virusgaming64.github.io/actions) [![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow?style=for-the-badge)](LICENSE) **A dynamic GitHub portfolio showcasing projects, statistics, and coding journey** [ğŸŒ Live Demo](https://virusgaming64.github.io) | [ğŸ“Š View Stats](https://virusgaming64.github.io) | [ğŸ› Report Bug](https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/virusgaming64.github.io/issues)
--- ## ğŸ“– About This Project ğŸŒŸ Welcome to my interactive GitHub portfolio! ğŸ‘‹ This website is a living showcase of my coding projects and development journey. ğŸš€ It automatically updates daily with the latest repository statistics, programming language usage, and project information directly from my GitHub profile. Built with vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS ğŸ’ª, this portfolio demonstrates clean code practices, API integration, and automation through GitHub Actions. The site features a modern, responsive design with animated backgrounds âœ¨ and an intuitive tabbed interface. ### âœ¨ Key Features - ğŸ”„ **Automated Daily Updates** - Repository statistics refresh automatically every day at 5:40 PM Cuba time (21:40 UTC) - ğŸ“Š **Real-Time Repository Stats** - Displays size, stars, forks, and descriptions for all repositories - ğŸ’» **Language Analytics** - Visual breakdown of programming languages used across projects - ğŸ¨ **Modern UI/UX** - Clean, responsive interface with animated particle background - ğŸ“± **Mobile Friendly** - Fully responsive design that works on all devices - âš¡ **Fast & Lightweight** - No heavy frameworks, just pure vanilla JavaScript - ğŸ” **Searchable & Organized** - Easy-to-navigate tabbed layout for repositories and languages --- ## ğŸš€ Live Demo ğŸŒ Visit the live website: **[virusgaming64.github.io](https://virusgaming64.github.io)** ğŸ‘ˆ The site features: - **ğŸ“¦ Repos Tab**: Browse all my GitHub repositories with detailed information ğŸ“š - **ğŸ’» Languages Tab**: See the programming languages I work with and their usage percentages ğŸ“ˆ --- ## ğŸ› ï¸ Technical Architecture âš™ï¸ ### How It Works ğŸ”§ This portfolio uses a three-component automated system: ğŸ¯ #### 1. ğŸ¤– GitHub Actions Workflow Located in `.github/workflows/update-repo-stats.yml`: - Runs automatically on a daily schedule (21:40 UTC) - Can be manually triggered from the Actions tab - Executes the Python data fetcher - Commits updated statistics back to the repository - Triggers automatic deployment to GitHub Pages #### 2. ğŸ Python Data Fetcher Script: `scripts/fetch_repo_stats.py` - Connects to GitHub API to fetch repository data - Retrieves comprehensive information for each repository - Calculates aggregate language statistics - Generates formatted size metrics (KB, MB, GB) - Saves structured data to `data/repo-stats.json` #### 3. ğŸŒ Interactive Web Interface Files: `index.html`, `src/main.js`, `src/main.css` - Loads and displays repository statistics dynamically - Renders animated particle background for visual appeal - Provides tabbed navigation between different views - Updates in real-time when new data is available - Fully responsive across desktop and mobile devices ### Data Structure ğŸ“‹ Repository statistics are stored in `data/repo-stats.json`: ğŸ’¾ ```json { "last_updated": "2025-11-08T21:40:00Z", "total_repositories": 15, "overall_languages": { "JavaScript": 45.5, "Python": 30.2, "HTML": 15.3, "CSS": 9.0 }, "repositories": [ { "name": "awesome-project", "description": "An amazing project description", "size_kb": 2048, "size_formatted": "2.0 MB", "languages": { "JavaScript": 70.5, "HTML": 20.0, "CSS": 9.5 }, "stars": 10, "forks": 3, "html_url": "https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/awesome-project", "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:30:00Z", "updated_at": "2025-11-08T15:20:00Z" } ] } ``` --- ## ğŸ’» Local Development ğŸ”¨ Want to run this project locally or contribute? Follow these steps: ğŸ‘‡ ### Prerequisites âœ… - ğŸ Python 3.7 or higher - ğŸ”‘ A GitHub Personal Access Token (for fetching repository data) - ğŸŒ A modern web browser - ğŸ“š Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript ### Setup Instructions ğŸ“ 1. **Clone the repository** ğŸ“¥ ```bash git clone https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/virusgaming64.github.io.git cd virusgaming64.github.io ``` 2. **Install Python dependencies** ğŸ“¦ ```bash pip install requests ``` 3. **Set up your GitHub token** ğŸ” ```bash # Linux/Mac export GITHUB_TOKEN=your_personal_access_token_here # Windows (PowerShell) $env:GITHUB_TOKEN="your_personal_access_token_here" ``` 4. **Fetch repository statistics** ğŸ“Š ```bash python scripts/fetch_repo_stats.py ``` 5. **Start a local web server** ğŸš€ ```bash # Python 3 python -m http.server 8000 # Or use any other local server like Live Server in VS Code ``` 6. **Open your browser** ğŸŒ Navigate to `http://localhost:8000` ğŸ‘€ ### Manual Statistics Update ğŸ”„ To manually update the repository statistics: âš¡ 1. Navigate to the **[Actions](https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/virusgaming64.github.io/actions)** tab ğŸ¬ 2. Select the **"Update Repository Statistics"** workflow ğŸ“‹ 3. Click **"Run workflow"** button â–¶ï¸ 4. Select the branch (usually `main`) ğŸŒ¿ 5. Click **"Run workflow"** to confirm âœ”ï¸ 6. Wait for the workflow to complete (usually takes 30-60 seconds) â±ï¸ 7. Refresh the website to see updated statistics ğŸ”ƒ --- ## ğŸ¤ Contributing ğŸ’¡ Contributions, issues, and feature requests are welcome! ğŸ‰ Feel free to check the [issues page](https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/virusgaming64.github.io/issues). ğŸ› ### How to Contribute ğŸŒŸ 1. ğŸ´ Fork the project 2. ğŸŒ¿ Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature`) 3. ğŸ’¾ Commit your changes (`git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature'`) 4. ğŸš€ Push to the branch (`git push origin feature/AmazingFeature`) 5. ğŸ Open a Pull Request --- ## ğŸ“ License ğŸ“œ This project is open source and available under the [MIT License](LICENSE). âš–ï¸ --- ## ğŸ“¬ Contact ğŸ’¬ **VIRUSGAMING64** ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’» - [@VIRUSGAMING64](https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64) Project Link: ğŸ”— [https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/virusgaming64.github.io](https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/virusgaming64.github.io) ---
**â­ Star this repository if you found it helpful! â­** Made with â¤ï¸ and â˜• by VIRUSGAMING64 ğŸ® Happy Coding! ğŸ’»

repositories.name: vshell
repositories.readme:
# ğŸš€ vshell

[![License: PolyForm Noncommercial 1.0.0](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-PolyForm%20Noncommercial%201.0.0-blue.svg)](LICENSE)
[![Python](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.10%2B-3776AB.svg?logo=python&logoColor=white)](requirements.txt)

Proyecto modular en Python que combina un nÃºcleo de automatizaciÃ³n (bot) y un componente web, con utilidades para descargas, compresiÃ³n y gestiÃ³n de usuarios. Este README documenta la estructura del proyecto, los mÃ³dulos disponibles y cÃ³mo ponerlo en marcha.

> â„¹ï¸ Nota: Este documento se ha generado a partir de la estructura actual del repositorio. Si tu flujo real de trabajo difiere (por ejemplo, variables de entorno, comandos o servicios especÃ­ficos), ajÃºstalo en la secciÃ³n ConfiguraciÃ³n.

---

## ğŸ“š Tabla de contenidos
- ğŸ“¦ Requisitos
- âš™ï¸ InstalaciÃ³n
- â–¶ï¸ EjecuciÃ³n rÃ¡pida
- ğŸ—‚ï¸ Estructura del proyecto
- ğŸ”Œ MÃ³dulos
- ğŸ› ï¸ Scripts auxiliares
- ğŸ§° ConfiguraciÃ³n
- ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ’» Desarrollo
- ğŸ“ Problemas conocidos / TODO
- ğŸ“„ Licencia

---

## ğŸ“¦ Requisitos

- Python 3.10+ (recomendado)
- pip actualizado
- Entorno virtual (opcional pero recomendado)

Dependencias del proyecto: ver [requirements.txt](requirements.txt).

---

## âš™ï¸ InstalaciÃ³n

1) Clonar el repositorio:
```bash
git clone https://github.com/VIRUSGAMING64/vshell.git
cd vshell
```

2) Crear y activar un entorno virtual (opcional):
- Linux/macOS:
  ```bash
  python -m venv .venv
  source .venv/bin/activate
  ```
- Windows (PowerShell):
  ```powershell
  python -m venv .venv
  .venv\Scripts\Activate.ps1
  ```

3) Instalar dependencias:
```bash
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

## ğŸ§° ConfiguraciÃ³n

La configuraciÃ³n depende de cÃ³mo `bot.py` y `modules/web.py` consuman parÃ¡metros. Patrones comunes:

- Variables de entorno (ejemplos):
  - `BOT_TOKEN`, `API_ID`, `API_HASH`, `ADMINS`
  - Rutas de salida para descargas/compresiÃ³n
  - ParÃ¡metros del servidor web (`HOST`, `PORT`)

- Archivos de configuraciÃ³n:
  - Si se usa, puede ser `.env`, YAML o JSON.

Ejemplos:

Linux/macOS:
```bash
export BOT_TOKEN="TU_TOKEN"
export PORT=8080
```

Windows (PowerShell):
```powershell
$env:BOT_TOKEN="TU_TOKEN"
$env:PORT=8080
```
